metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25775 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper access control in the Intel(R) Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux before version 1.9.30 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access. Ivan D Barrera, Christopher Bednarz, Mustafa Ismail, and Shiraz Saleem discovered that the InfiniBand RDMA driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for zero-length STAG or MR registration. A remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic - 6.2.0-37.38
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic-64k - 6.2.0-37.38
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-aws - 6.2.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-azure - 6.2.0-1018.18

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-37.38').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1016.16').
linux-azure package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.2.0-1018.18').
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.2.0-1020.22').
